column4: back for a few... suggestions on troubleshooting the Remote Desktop Viewer?  1 pc is running 9.10 and the other is 8.04 LTS ... both sytems up-to-date
What are you trying and what is not working?
the Find button in remote viewer finds nothing when I click on Domain and select local
if I enter the IP address of the other pc in the Host field  i.e. 192.169.102 ... it fails to connect
yes, it pings and I can ssh into it and do remote admin
Did you configure the machine in sys>prefs>remote desktop?
yes, both machines are configured to ask for a password
I can't find any documentation on the settings anywhere
is there a HOW-TO or FAQ anywhere for Remoter Desktop Viewer?
I dont know, someone would have to google..
I have a lot of experience with PUTTY and ssh on UNIX and Windows... so I'm not exactly a newbie to this
How I usually set it up is in sys>prefs>remote desktop, configure it to accept connections so I can connect to it from another machine
Then vino should be running and should allow you to connect. Try restarting the vino service
good idea, I have not checked the service...
I mispoke... the machines saw each other yesterday before I replaced CentOS with Ubuntu 8.04 LTS on the machine and now they can't see each other. hmmm....
